conclusion: Determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles from points A, B, C, and D.
Liquid from A encounters a black baffle, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from A flows down and enters container F.
Liquid from B encounters a brown baffle, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from B flows down and enters container F.
Liquid from C encounters a blue baffle, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from C flows down and enters container G.
Liquid from D encounters a yellow baffle, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from D flows down and enters container G.
Liquid from A and B flows into container F.
Liquid from C and D flows into container G.
Final Answer: Liquid from A and B will flow into container F. Liquid from C and D will flow into container G.
